MemoryInfobox.name: Left to Dye
MemoryInfobox.description: 'Empedokles, freed from his bondage, requested that Kassandra find his purple cloak - though it was the Key to Olympos|key hidden inside that was the most important item of all.'

General_Description: '''Left to Dye''' was a virtual representation of one of [[Kassandra]]'s genetic memories, relived by [[Layla Hassan]] through the Portable [[Animus|Animus HR-8.5]].
Section_Description: [[Empedokles]] requested Kassandra to retrieve a [[Key to Olympos|key]] from a [[Greek brute|thief]].
Section_Dialogue:
Accepting Empedokles' request, Kassandra went to look for the thief who stole the disk. After a bit of searching, she found the thief with his [[guard]]s. *'''Greek Brute:''' ''Purple dye might stink like rotten dog guts, but I'll be fucked if doesn't make me look like a god!'' *'''Greek Soldier:''' ''Technically it's made from rotten snail guts, boss.'' *'''Greek Brute:''' ''...I'm wearing snail guts?'' Kassandra killed the thief and his guards, recovering a pair of [[Purple Bracers|bracers]] and the disk from the thief's corpse. She then returned to Empedokles at his [[Statue of Empedokles|statue]]. *'''Empedokles:''' ''Ah, look how she strides! The confidence! If I didn't know better, I'd say there were ''two'' gods on [[Kythera Island|Kythera]]!'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''I found your disk.'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''Praise ''me''! Clearly, I have worked through you.'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''Clearly. Time to meet the gods, then?'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''I'd love to introduce you to my family—of course, if you're ready to join me?'' (Reject - No, enough of this.) '''Kassandra:''' First, I have other matters to attend to.. '''Empedokles:''' Matters more important than meeting the gods?! Your life must be a blessed adventure. (After conversation with Empedokles) '''Civilian 1:''' Praise Empedokles! Oh, oh praise him! [[File:ACOD Left to Dye 2.png|thumb|250px|Empedokles asking Kassandra to meet his "siblings"]] (Accept – Yes, I will.) *'''Kassandra:''' ''This should be interesting.'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''That, my dear ''[[Mercenary|misthios]]'', I can absolutely guarantee.
A moment please, while I address my audience.'' Empedokles turned to his [[Empedoklite|followers]]. *'''Empedokles:''' ''Rejoice! For I, your humble god, shall introduce you to my brothers and sisters.
[[Athena]] awaits you!
Ares demands your audience!'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''That's a big promise.'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''You doubt me?!'' |-|I doubt you.= *'''Kassandra:''' ''I doubt you could get us to the ocean. It's behind you, by the way.'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''How dare you mock—I—I'm a god! A ''god''!'' Empedokles turned to one of his follower. *'''Empedokles:''' ''What am I?!'' *'''Civilian:''' ''A—a god?'' *'''Kassandra:''' ''Thanks for clearing that up.'' |-|I believe in you.= *'''Kassandra:''' ''I don't doubt the joy you've brought to your followers.'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''Their loyalty will be rewarded. As will yours.'' *'''Empedokles:''' ''We set sail for the [[Gulf of Korinth]], and all the secrets she veils! Meet us there and see the truth for yourself.'' (Accept – I'll see you there.) *'''Kassandra:''' ''And meet your siblings? Wouldn't miss it.'' If Empedokles was spoken to once more. *'''Empedokles:''' ''To the Gulf of Korinth, and all she hides, ''misthios! If Kassandra speaks to the nearby civilian. *'''Civilian 1:''' ''Do you really think Empedokles is a God?'' *'''Civilian 2:''' ''I couldn't give a shit if he was a rooster - I'm just here to get away from the Priestesses.''
Section_Outcome: Kassandra helped Empedokles reclaim the so-called key to [[Mount Olympus|Olympus]]. She agreed to meet him at the [[Isle of Thisvi|island]] in the Gulf of Korinth.
Section_Behind_the_scenes: The two brutes guarding the thief carrying the key have unique avatars when viewed by Ikaros. They can be knocked out and recruited as lieutenants for the Adrestia.
